content: round 28 k2tog k2 x 3 dark yarn 9 sts rounds 29-30 k all light yarn 2 rounds 9 sts round 31 k all dark yarn 9 sts rounds 32-33 k all light yarn 2 rounds 9 sts round 34 k2tog k1 x 3 dark yarn 6 sts © maggie l wood © mage wood whimsies 3 rounds 35-36 k all light yarn 2 rounds 6 sts round 37 k all dark yarn 6 sts rounds 38-39 k all light yarn 2 rounds 6 sts round 40 k2tog x 3 dark yarn 3 sts rounds 41-43 k all dark yarn 3 rounds 3 sts bind off last 3 stitches by sewing the yarn tail through them and hiding all the ends into the hat the shape of the finished hat should look like fig 2 set the hat aside for now and work on the ears elf ears make 2 ears are knitted flat in stocking stitch with yarn chosen for the ears cast on 9 stitches row 1 k all 9 sts row 2 slip_stitch first st knit-wise p8 9 sts row 3 slip_stitch first st purl-wise k8 9 sts row 4 slip_stitch knit-wise p8 9 sts row 5 slip_stitch purl-wise k8 9 sts row 6 slip_stitch knit-wise p8 9 sts fig 2 row 7 slip_stitch purl-wise k2 s2kpo k3 7 sts row 8 slip_stitch knit-wise p6 7 sts row 9 slip_stitch purl-wise k1 s2kpo k2 5 sts row 10 slip_stitch knit-wise p4 5 sts row 11 slip_stitch purl-wise s2kpo k1 3 sts row 12 slip_stitch knit-wise p2 3 sts row 13 s2kpo 1 st top of ear when completed elf ears should look like fig 3 yarn tail choose which ear is left and which one is right yarn tail and then take the yarn tail leftover at the tip of the ear and weave it into the side of the ear that will be the top of the ear see fig 3 leaving the yarn tails at the bottom for sewing then set the ears aside for now and work on the sides of the hat fig 3 © maggie l wood © mage wood whimsies 4 sides of hat find back of hat and then while holding the hat upside down with darker coloured yarn pick up and knit 5 stitches on the left side of the hat start about 3 or 4 stitches from the back seam row 1 p5 5 sts row 2 k5 5 sts row 3 p5 5 sts row 4 k1 s2kpo k1 3 sts row 5 p3 3 sts row 6 k3 3 sts row 7 p3 3 sts row 8 k2tog k1 2 sts row 9 p2 2 sts row 10 k2 2 sts for the ties do i-cord on 2 stitches for 5 inches *note the hat made for this pattern is for a smaller toad that i made using 2 mm needles for making the hat for a regular toad made with 2 5 mm needles do
